page.title: 17HIGH LIPWOOD, HAYDON BRIDGE
page.content: The buildings here are interesting. The largest was converted from a {grange}in 1973. It retains its{hemmel arches as an interesting feature of the dining room, & on the first floor old beams cross the corridor.A dovecot in the garden is still used by white doves and the slits in its wall still ventilate the building. Col. & Mrs. Nicholl own the house. The Col. was in the Rifle Brigade & served in N.Africa & Italy during the War. He was also {High Sherriff of Northumberland,}& as such was in charge of{Assize Court arrangements in{Newcastle.High Lipwood cottage still has a flagged roof. Its owner, Mrs.Eaves,has traced its history back to{Queen Elizabeth's reign, & is pursuing it back to the 13th.Century. Both houses have sheltered cottage gardens.
